[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Monitoring] [Event metrics] Are there metrics tracking UriMutation event count, size distribution, and processing time? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Monitoring] [Anomaly detection] Can sudden spikes in UriMutation events trigger alerts for potential attacks? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Observability] [Trace logging] Does event processing have sufficient logging for debugging production issues? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Monitoring] [Error rates] Are deserialization failures tracked and alerted on to detect malicious events? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Attack vector] [Event flooding] Can an attacker create a token with mutable URI and repeatedly mutate it to flood event streams? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Attack vector] [Frontrunning] Can attackers monitor pending URI mutations and frontrun them to manipulate token metadata? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Attack vector] [Griefing] Can malicious actors emit meaningless UriMutation events to grief indexer operators with increased costs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Attack vector] [Metadata poisoning] Can attackers mutate URIs to point to malicious metadata, affecting all applications displaying the token? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Attack vector] [Time-of-check-time-of-use] Can URI change between event emission and metadata fetching, causing TOCTOU vulnerabilities? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/uri_mutation.rs] [Integration] [Token ownership] Does the event verify that the creator actually owns the token being mutated? (High)
